result.execSummary:
All charges against Dejaquan Jeffrey Mast-Hochstedler in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dejaquan Jeffrey Mast-Hochstedler is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dejaquan Jeffrey Mast-Hochstedler

Defendant Dejaquan Jeffrey Mast-Hochstedler not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Dejaquan Jeffrey Mast-Hochstedler.  Attorney William T. Berens in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State unable to proceed.  Motion to dismiss by the defense argued and GRANTED by the Court.  Case dismissed without prejudice.
Defendant's Demand for Speedy Trial.  (Dejaquan J. Mast-Hochstedler - #2022001026, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

HELD OFF RECORD WITH APPROVAL OF JUDGE HANRAHAN. Defendant Dejaquan Jeffrey Mast-Hochstedler not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Dejaquan Jeffrey Mast-Hochstedler.  Attorney William T. Berens in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties advised case remains in trial posture. Case adjourned in Branch 4 in jury trial.

Court in trial on another case. Case adjourned in Branch 4. Parties notified.
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Letter from defendant re:  bail modification and demand for speedy trial.  (DeJaquan Mast-Hochstedler - #2022001026, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court, defendant Dejaquan Jeffrey Mast-Hochstedler not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial. State advises not prepared to proceed due to witnesses unavailability. State requests adjournment. Defense requests dismissal. Defense advises of defendant's speedy trial demand. Court advises defense that speedy trial demands can not be entered prior to prelim. Court grants adjournment request and denies motion for dismissal. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dejaquan Jeffrey Mast-Hochstedler in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by the final pretrial date. Any other motions and notice of alibi must be filed by the final pretrial.  Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 4.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dejaquan Jeffrey Mast-Hochstedler in court with Attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Dejaquan Jeffrey Mast-Hochstedler in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 04, Judge Hanrahan. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
received and filed.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail and Demand for Speedy Trial.  (Dejaquan Mast-Hochstedler - #2022001026, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Dejaquan Jeffrey Mast-Hochstedler not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to remain in custody until a device becomes available.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with E. B. G.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dejaquan Jeffrey Mast-Hochstedler in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Dejaquan Jeffrey Mast-Hochstedler in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dejaquan Jeffrey Mast-Hochstedler appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No contact order signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
